Class Monopoly

java.lang.Object
  Monopoly

public class Monopoly
extends java.lang.Object

This version of Monopoly uses Player, Property, and Die to simulate playing a game of Monopoly using text based input and output (game is played at the command line).

Version:
1.0.9
Author:
Thomas Zaki

setPlayerNames

public static void setPlayerNames(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                                  java.util.Scanner in)
Assigns names to all of the players in the current game

players - an ArrayList of Player objects
in - a Scanner object to receive user input

createProperties

public static void createProperties(java.util.ArrayList<Property> properties)
Assigns initial values to all of the Property objects on a Monopoly board and then adds them to an ArrayList defined and accessible in the main method

Parameters:
properties - an ArrayList of Property objects to which the properties will be added to

takeTurn

public static boolean takeTurn(Player p,
                               Die d6,
                               java.util.ArrayList<Property> properties,
                               boolean gameOver,
                               java.util.Scanner in)
This method handles all of the actions a Player can carry out during his turn (as defined by this version of Monopoly)

Parameters:
p - the player taking the turn
d6 - a six-sided Die
properties - the ArrayList of Property objects that store all of the spaces on the Monopoly board
gameOver - an initial value (false) for gameOver
in - a Scanner object to receive user input
Returns:
the resulting value of gameOver
